template: Create port scanning pattern targeting web servers
attack_code:
Port Scanning:

Web Server Target: HTTPS Port (443)
Target IP Addresses: 192.168.1.100-105
Target Ports: 443
Duration: 4 hours
Frequency: Daily
Action: Scan all web servers for vulnerabilities using common port scanning patterns. Note that this is just a sample pattern, and it's recommended to customize it based on the specific needs of your organization.

Forensic Investigation:

Web Server Target: HTTPS Port (443)
Target IP Addresses: 192.168.1.100-105
Target Ports: 443
Duration: 4 hours
Frequency: Daily
Action: Collect evidence, including sensitive data, via packet capture and network traffic analysis techniques. Utilize forensic tools and procedures to gather relevant data.

Identification of Vulnerabilities:

Web Server Target: HTTPS Port (443)
Target IP Addresses: 192.168.1.100-105
Target Ports: 443
Duration: 4 hours
Frequency: Daily
Action: Analyze the collected data to identify vulnerabilities. Identify areas of concern or weaknesses within your web servers and take appropriate action accordingly.

Auditing:

Web Server Target: HTTPS Port (443)
Target IP Addresses: 192.168.1.100-105
Target Ports: 443
Duration: 4 hours
Frequency: Daily
Action: Conduct regular audits to ensure that your web servers remain secure and up-to-date. Review the stored logs, packet
